meanings.definition: The act of isolating oneself or others to prevent the spread of disease.
meanings.sent1: During the quarantine, everyone stayed at home to avoid getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The quarantining of the infected patients helped stop the virus from spreading.
meanings.sent3: The family turned quarantining into a game by playing board games all day.
meanings.sent4: Her room became a quarantine zone, keeping her safe from the contagious flu.
meanings.sent5: The importance of quarantining became clear when the illness spread rapidly in the community.

meanings.definition: The process of keeping individuals or items separate to avoid contamination.
meanings.sent1: Proper quarantining of food items prevents cross-contamination in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The quarantining of the contaminated samples ensured the lab's safety.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked about quarantining the spicy ingredients to avoid flavor mixing.
meanings.sent4: The idea of quarantining thoughts helped her focus on one task at a time.
meanings.sent5: The strict quarantining of the chemicals prevented a dangerous reaction.

meanings.definition: The practice of restricting movement or contact to limit exposure to illness.
meanings.sent1: The quarantining of the sick individuals prevented the disease from spreading.
meanings.sent2: Quarantining travelers from high-risk areas helped control the outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be quarantining itself from the noisy children in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure led to quarantining herself from new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The strict quarantining of the patient's room kept the medical staff safe from infection.
